title: Correlative Cryogenic Transmission Electron Microscopy of Structural Phase Transition in Multiferroic GaV4S8
content: Cryogenic transmission electron microscopy (cryo-TEM) is a powerful technique to probe nanoscale structural evolution in condensed matter systems under controlled cooling [1]. However, since structure characterization and property measurement are typically conducted on separate samples with varying dimensions, establishing a precise structure-property relationship is often challenging. In this study, we show a direct correlation between formation of structural domains and transport properties measured on same TEM samples of lacunar spinel multiferroic GaV4S8 crystal. In the inverse spinel structure, the V4S4 tetrahedral clusters with triply degenerate occupied orbitals are Jahn-Teller active, driving a symmetry-lowering cooperative Jahn-Teller distortion around 42 K [2].
